update.description:
While testing other pull requests, I saw some intermittent failures of the `SimApiTest.HxsSimInfo` test:
~~~
[ RUN      ] SimApiTest.HxsSimInfo
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.2.90
[Wrn] [ImuSensor.cc:91] Deprecation: IMU noise SDF value have changed. Please refer to http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=sensor#sensor_imu
[Wrn] [ImuSensor.cc:91] Deprecation: IMU noise SDF value have changed. Please refer to http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=sensor#sensor_imu
[Wrn] [ImuSensor.cc:91] Deprecation: IMU noise SDF value have changed. Please refer to http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=sensor#sensor_imu
[Wrn] [ImuSensor.cc:91] Deprecation: IMU noise SDF value have changed. Please refer to http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=sensor#sensor_imu
[Wrn] [ImuSensor.cc:91] Deprecation: IMU noise SDF value have changed. Please refer to http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=sensor#sensor_imu
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:169] ServerFixture load in 1.1 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
[Err] [Visual.cc:2165] Unable to insert mesh[Cannot create GL vertex buffer]
world name: [default]
[Wrn] [HaptixControlPlugin.cc:152] no polhemus_source model detected using predefine location.
[Dbg] [HaptixControlPlugin.cc:159] Polhemus Source Pose [-0.5 0 1.3 3.14159 0 -1.57159]
libusb_open_device_with_vid_pid() failed
Failed to connect to Polhemus
[Wrn] [HaptixControlPlugin.cc:323] No usable polhemus setup detected.
Successfully connected to keyboard node
hxs_sim_info() Service call timed out.
/home/scpeters/ws/handsim/src/handsim/test/integration/sim_api.cc:167: Failure
Value of: hxOK
  Actual: 0
Expected: hxs_sim_info(&simInfo)
Which is: 1
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:118] ServerFixture::Unload
[  FAILED  ] SimApiTest.HxsSimInfo (2732 ms)
~~~

For the successful tests, I saw the `ServerFixture load` message after the `world name: [default]` message, but the failed tests had this message appearing first. That suggests an initialization problem. The `WorldPlugin`s and `ModelPlugin`s are not initialized until the first `World::Step`, so this PR takes a world step before calling `hxs_sim_info` to ensure that WorldPlugin's and ModelPlugin's have been loaded and makes the `SimApiTest.HxsSimInfo` test more reliable for me.
update.title: Improve SimApiTest.HxsSimInfo test reliability

content.raw: ok I created #95 to track the ideas for better fixes; I'll merge this for now.
content.html: ok I created #95 to track the ideas for better fixes; I'll merge this for now.

content.raw: Up to you. I'll approve this as a temporary fix, and we can issue + discuss better fix there?
content.html: Up to you. I'll approve this as a temporary fix, and we can issue + discuss better fix there?

content.raw: If you load the world in a paused state, then it will never initialize the plugins, since they are only initialized during the first `World::Step` (see pull request description)
content.html: If you load the world in a paused state, then it will never initialize the plugins, since they are only initialized during the first World::Step (see pull request description)

update.title: Improve SimApiTest.HxsSimInfo test reliability

content.raw:
It seems that the problem is in `ServerFixture::LoadArgs()` that doesn't block enough time to guarantee that the world has been initialized.

What about adding an extra condition that blocks `LoadArgs()` until `physics::worlds_running()`? I'm testing it right now.
content.html:
It seems that the problem is in ServerFixture::LoadArgs() that doesn't block enough time to guarantee that the world has been initialized.

What about adding an extra condition that blocks LoadArgs() until physics::worlds_running()? I'm testing it right now.

content.raw: Those sound like better solutions. Shall I decline this and create an issue to further this discussion?
content.html: Those sound like better solutions. Shall I decline this and create an issue to further this discussion?

content.raw:
just brainstorming a different fix for this kind of simulation startup problem.

- loop over `hxs_sim_info()` until success (i.e. [HaptixWorldPlugin::Load()](#!/osrf/handsim/src/e7492785a61c78bc76ca0aecbeb03834cea5b962/src/HaptixWorldPlugin.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#HaptixWorldPlugin.cc-125) has finished loading).
- check to see if `/haptix/gazebo/hxs_sim_info` has been advertised by the simulator before continuing

any suggestions?

thanks,

John
content.html:
just brainstorming a different fix for this kind of simulation startup problem.

  • loop over hxs_sim_info() until success (i.e. HaptixWorldPlugin::Load() has finished loading).
  • check to see if /haptix/gazebo/hxs_sim_info has been advertised by the simulator before continuing

any suggestions?

thanks,

John
